Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: @gcharang Thank you. I tried that guide, but I have one issue. In the guide, it says that running `getinfo` on either of the daemons should report `connection: 1`. But in my case, both return 2. What does this mean?

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: Also, even though I added a line that specified  `port=SOME_PORT_NUMBER`,  both the daemons show the same port number when run.

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: I've tried with different port numbers also. Rpc port number is different for both, but not p2p port number.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
those are all fine @krtk6160 
```
either of the daemons should report connection: 1. But in my case, both return 1
```
"both return 1" is what I meant will clarify in the docs

```
both the daemons show the same port number when run. 
```
if it's in the daemon output, that is the standard numbers based on the params supplied and can be ignored. The only important rthing is are the rpc commands working on the rpc ports that you have specified and the daemon able to connect to other nodes with the p2pport (just "port") that you have specified

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: @gcharang I'm sorry, I made a typo. What is happening is that both return 2.

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: The docs were clear, don't worry about that üòÑ

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: do you have the same assetchain running in a different system?

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: No, I only have 1 machine, my personal laptop

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: same assetchain == same parameters

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: let me start a chain and check

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: Okay

Author: krtk6160#3131
krtk6160#3131
Content: So I don't know which account has that balance.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
`""` is some deprecated account related stuff
there are no accounts right now
only addresses
you can do listunspent to see which address the balance is in

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: you can use getbalance for the total wallet balance

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
```
{
  "walletversion": 60000,
  "balance": 10.01334496,
  "unconfirmed_balance": 0.0,
  "immature_balance": 0.0001,
  "txcount": 106,
  "keypoololdest": 1536889653,
  "keypoolsize": 101,
  "paytxfee": 0.0
}
```
should be the result of  getwalletinfo
did you just get 
```
{
  "": 777777.05244666
}
```

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: No, I got that for `listaccounts`

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: I'm getting the output of getwalletinfo just like you mentioned

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: listunspent returns a long list of txns with a lot of different addresses. Is it not possible to initialize an assetchain that assigns all the premined coins to 1 particular address?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
yes you can do that with  `-pubkey` option in one of the nodes
do it like this:  https://docs.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/customconsensus/custom-consensus-instructions.html#creating-and-launching-with-a-pubkey

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
make sure you `dumpprivkey` for the pubkey and save it
and mine the first block on the node that has the `-pubkey` in the daemon launch command
-pubkey is a local thing to a node and not related to the other `-ac_` params

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
https://docs.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/komodo-api/wallet.html#listaccounts
as a general rule anything related to accounts is deprecated a long time ago
look at the docs if something is not clear

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
I have started a fresh chain using two nodes on the same system with different data dirs, after the second node is launched, both were showing `connection: 1`
maybe try starting a fresh chain?

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content:
I had already set the `pubkey`, and then I ran getaddressbalance for that address. It says 
`Error code: -5
No information available for the address`

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: I'll start afresh now

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: And then see if it fixes that

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: you can consolidate funds to a single address using `komodo-cli -ac_name=NAME sendtoaddress <ADDRESS> (komodo-cli  -ac_name=NAME getbalance) "" "" true`

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
if the pubkey was created on another wallet, you need to import the corresponding privkey for the balance to show up
and when you set the pubkey and mine on the same daemon, all mining rewards should go to that pubkey's address

Content: @gcharang I was able to successfully test it and it works

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: Thank you!

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: that's great

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: I read that 95% of all tokens in existence are atomic-swappable

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: How can I try that functionality out?

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: Say for example I made my own assetchain, and have 1000 tokens. If I have some ERC20 token on the Ethereum blockchain, is it possible to exchange that somehow?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
```
I read that 95% of all tokens in existence are atomic-swappable
```
"coins"

```
Say for example I made my own assetchain, and have 1000 tokens.
```
by tokens, you mean the base coins or ones created using: https://docs.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/customconsensus/tokens.html ?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: ERC20 token on the Ethereum blockchain are swappable with 95% of coins. yes

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: By tokens I mean the ones I get from mining on my own assetchain

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
yes, those are by default compatible with our DEX and swappable with any other crypto
version 1 of the backend is shelved for now and version2 is under testing. you can ask for access if you want to test that out

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content:
So I can swap my base coins with some Ether, right?
Can I swap my base coins with a custom ERC20 token that's present on the Ethereum chain?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: yes to both

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: Wow

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: Is there any guide to do that?

Author: krtk6160#3131
Content: Also, what if my tokens are not on the main Eth chain, but on one of the testing chains? Will it still be possible to somehow test swapping?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
I have mentioned you in the channel related to testing the DEX, after someone adds you, you can  get started
docs here: https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/developer-docs/tree/mm/docs/basic-docs/atomic-swap-dex

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
```
Also, what if my tokens are not on the main Eth chain, but on one of the testing chains? Will it still be possible to somehow test swapping?
```
possible, but need to change some configs I think, better to ask in that channel once you are added

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
that should be a simple change:
https://github.com/jl777/coins#5-ethereum-info-file-required-for-etherc20
just editing the coins data

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/developer-docs/blob/mm/docs/basic-docs/atomic-swap-dex/dex-api.md#using-komodo-dex-software-on-an-eth-based-network

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
https://github.com/gcharang/create-assetchain @krtk6160 
scripts that automate the steps in the doc: https://docs.komodoplatform.com/assetchains/create-asset-chain-single-node.html

Content: @gcharang Looks great, thanks

Author: LeshAft9#0083
Content:
Too bad Magnum Wallet is sketchy. 
1) they don't offer the ability to show your receive address on the ledger nano device so you can confirm it's correct. this is standard expected of any wallet app that supports ledger nano. 
2) the browser pops up a notification that they are requesting permission to read the contents of your clipboard, that's very unsafe for a user to agree to
3) the team listed are anonymous

Author: LeshAft9#0083
Content: also for trying to transact with ledger nano, their site is broken due to CORS in brave (even with shields down) and firefox
